reasoning: GI atresia (esophageal/duodenal/intestinal atresia) is a congenital birth defect with estimated incidence of 2.5-3.5 per 100k births globally. Most common type is duodenal atresia. Data from birth defect registries and pediatric surgery literature.
source: Bianchi DW et al. (2012). Fetal diagnosis and therapy of congenital anomalies. In: Creasy and Resnik's Maternal-Fetal Medicine. Saunders Elsevier. Chapter 19
